intro: Clidemia polystachya, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are usually opposite and covered in a fine, velvety pubescence. Clidemia polystachya plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various native insects and birds.
